)

Constructs a new IMU filter given an expected system noise and covariance and measurement noise and covariance.

Author:
Adam Panzica
Parameters:
[in]state_sizeThe number of states in the system vector
[in]input_sizeThe number of inputs in the u vector
[in]measurement_sizeThe number of states in the measurement vector
[in]sys_noise_muThe expected system noise
[in]sys_noise_covThe expected system covariance
[in]measurement_noise_muThe expected measurement noise
[in]measurement_noise_covThe expected measurement covariance

bool LinearFilter::getEstimate ( ColumnVector &  estimate,
SymmetricMatrix &  covar 
) const

Gets the latest state estimate from the filter.

Author:
Adam Panzica
Parameters:
[out]estimateVector to write the state estimate to
[out]covarMatrix to write the state estimate covariance to
Returns:
True if the estimate was sucessfully retrieved, else false

Note that the init method must have been called prior to getting estimates

bool LinearFilter::init ( const ColumnVector &  initial_state,
const SymmetricMatrix &  initial_covar 
)

Initializes the filter to an initial state estimate and covariance.

Author:
Adam Panzica
Parameters:
[in]initial_stateThe initial state estimate
[in]initial_covarThe initial state estimate covariance
Returns:
True if sucessfully intialized, else false

Note that the size of the state vector and covariance matrix must match the size defined by the constant SYSTEM_STATE_SIZE

bool LinearFilter::update ( const ColumnVector &  input,
const ColumnVector &  measurement 
)

Updates the filter given new system input and measurement.

Author:
Adam Panzica
Parameters:
[in]inputThe new system input
[in]measurementThe new state measurement
Returns:
True if succesfully updated, else false Note that the init method must be called before performing filter updates.

Note that the size of the input and measurement vectors must match the size defined by the constants INPUT_SIZE and MEASUREMENT_SIZE

Definition at line 83 of file linearfilter.cpp.

bool LinearFilter::update ( )

Updates the filter based purely on the system model.

Author:
Adam Panzica
Returns:
True if the filter successfully is updated

This is intended to be used if the sensor missed an update cycle before time ran out. It moves the filter along based purely on the system model
